In this role Alexis honed her relationship-building and training skills and successfully trained and mentored over 15+ new hires. In addition she earned a Bachelor&#x27;s degree in Business Administration from Metropolitan State University. Later  Alexis joined CSX Transportation and was promoted to Manager of Operations and Data Control where she excelled at data analysis and operations support\u2014resolving over 1000 support cases monthly.\n\nNext Alexis earned her teaching certification and taught English as a foreign language in Prague Czech Republic. Subsequently Alexis gained experience in various industries from public transportation to software development. Most recently as an Affiliate Service Coordinator at Commercial Fire Alexis leveraged her relationship-building and operational support talents to manage a rolling portfolio of fire systems work orders totaling $500k. A proponent of continuous learning Alexis will complete a Master of Project Management and a Master of Arts in Organizational Leadership in 2023. Today after completing the SV Academy Customer Success fellowship she\u2019s keen to launch her career in the tech industry as a Customer Success professional.\n", "extra": null}, {"type": "file", "name": "Personal Narrative Draft 1 (Alexis Lindsay, CS27).docx", "id": "file-dMbcHVzlvVPkOlztnPFwKwAG", "source": "my_files", "text": "\nPersonal Narrative \nI\u2019m originally from New York City but life and various professional opportunities have allowed me to make my home in multiple places over the years. Each place I move to it is a joy for me to explore the local culture and get to know the people. Reflecting on it I\u2019m confident that growing up and switching between my parent&#x27;s homes in two different states gave me an appreciation for constantly changing environments and the adaptability to enjoy them.\n\tI moved to Minnesota to attend career training in 2004 and eventually in 2012 I earned my Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration from Metropolitan State University. The following year after graduating from university I joined CSX railway in a managerial role. During my time with CSX railway  I discovered my talents for relationship building adaptability and process improvement to be an essential element to successfully leading teams and reaching desired outcomes. \n\tAfter leaving CSX I moved to Prague Czech Republic and became certified in teaching English as a foreign language. After earning my teaching certification I began working with young learners aged 5-14.  It was here that I further developed my presentation and public speaking skills. I leveraged these talents to support my students and their parents in reaching their desired learning outcomes. Overall it was immensely gratifying to find that by helping others reach their learning objectives through sharing my native language and culture I also synergistically maximized my cultural immersion experience.\n\tAfter returning to the United States I developed my professional skill set more.  I  worked in various industries from software development to fire protection systems. However my natural curiosity and dedication to continuous learning were always at the forefront driving me toward discovering where my most extraordinary talents lie. \nDuring this time I learned that I thrive on helping and supporting others and that my best tools to help others were through active listening and engagement. I also discovered that I am passionate about data-driven analytical thinking regardless of industry or position. I believe this is always the best approach to finding innovative solutions. Finally enthusiasm for an activity increases effectiveness; therefore I approach every task enthusiastically for efficiency and success. Today I am excited and enthusiastic to leverage these skills and talents in a customer success role where I\u2019ll be able to proactively support customers in reaching their desired outcomes while utilizing my vast array of talents to achieve organizational objectives.\n\n\n\nOriginally from New York City Alexis Lindsay began her professional career with Canadian Pacific Railway in 2005 as a Customer Service Operations Representative at their Minneapolis Minnesota headquarters. At Canadian Pacific Alexis honed her relationship-building and training skills successfully training and mentoring over 15+ new hires during her tenure in the role. In 2012 Alexis earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration from Metropolitan State University. After earning her degree Alexis joined CSX Transportation as a Service Center Manager before being promoted to Manager of Operations and Data Control. While in the role Alexis excelled at data analysis and operations support  resolving over 1000 support cases monthly.\n In 2017 Alexis earned her teaching certification and taught English as a foreign language in Prague Czech Republic. After returning to the United States Alexis gained experience in various industries from public transportation to commercial fire protection. Most recently as an Affiliate Service Coordinator at Commercial Fire Alexis leveraged her relationship-building and operational support talents to manage a rolling portfolio of fire systems work orders totaling over $500k. A proponent of continuous learning Alexis is on track to complete a Master of Project Management degree and a Master of Arts in Organizational Leadership in 2023. Today after completing the SV Academy Customer Success fellowship Alexis is keen to launch her career in the tech industry as a Customer Success professional.\n", "extra": null}, {"type": "file", "name": "Personal Narrative Draft 2.docx", "id": "file-I8xRHh7mV7eOq1a2kntHexHI", "source": "my_files", "text": "\nPersonal Narrative \n\nAlexis Lindsay began her professional career as a Customer Service Operations Representative with Canadian Pacific Railway. In this role Alexis honed her relationship-building and training skills and successfully trained and mentored over 15+ new hires. In addition she earned a Bachelor&#x27;s degree in Business Administration from Metropolitan State University. Later  Alexis joined CSX Transportation and was promoted to Manager of Operations and Data Control where she excelled at data analysis and operations support\u2014resolving over 1000 support cases monthly.\n\nNext Alexis earned her teaching certification and taught English as a foreign language in Prague Czech Republic. Subsequently Alexis gained experience in various industries from public transportation to software development. Most recently as an Affiliate Service Coordinator at Commercial Fire Alexis leveraged her relationship-building and operational support talents to manage a rolling portfolio of fire systems work orders totaling $500k. A proponent of continuous learning Alexis will complete a Master of Project Management and a Master of Arts in Organizational Leadership in 2023. Today after completing the SV Academy Customer Success fellowship she\u2019s keen to launch her career in the tech industry as a Customer Success professional.\n", "extra": null}, {"type": "file", "name": "Personal Narrative Draft 1 (Alexis Lindsay, CS27).docx", "id": "file-H6QijX4b25rovu5gfFd2CoPi", "source": "my_files", "text": "\nPersonal Narrative \nI\u2019m originally from New York City but life and various professional opportunities have allowed me to make my home in multiple places over the years. Each place I move to it is a joy for me to explore the local culture and get to know the people. Reflecting on it I\u2019m confident that growing up and switching between my parent&#x27;s homes in two different states gave me an appreciation for constantly changing environments and the adaptability to enjoy them.\n\tI moved to Minnesota to attend career training in 2004 and eventually in 2012 I earned my Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration from Metropolitan State University. The following year after graduating from university I joined CSX railway in a managerial role. During my time with CSX railway  I discovered my talents for relationship building adaptability and process improvement to be an essential element to successfully leading teams and reaching desired outcomes. \n\tAfter leaving CSX I moved to Prague Czech Republic and became certified in teaching English as a foreign language. After earning my teaching certification I began working with young learners aged 5-14.  It was here that I further developed my presentation and public speaking skills. I leveraged these talents to support my students and their parents in reaching their desired learning outcomes. Overall it was immensely gratifying to find that by helping others reach their learning objectives through sharing my native language and culture I also synergistically maximized my cultural immersion experience.\n\tAfter returning to the United States I developed my professional skill set more.  I  worked in various industries from software development to fire protection systems. However my natural curiosity and dedication to continuous learning were always at the forefront driving me toward discovering where my most extraordinary talents lie. \nDuring this time I learned that I thrive on helping and supporting others and that my best tools to help others were through active listening and engagement. I also discovered that I am passionate about data-driven analytical thinking regardless of industry or position. I believe this is always the best approach to finding innovative solutions. Finally enthusiasm for an activity increases effectiveness; therefore I approach every task enthusiastically for efficiency and success. Today I am excited and enthusiastic to leverage these skills and talents in a customer success role where I\u2019ll be able to proactively support customers in reaching their desired outcomes while utilizing my vast array of talents to achieve organizational objectives.\n\n\n\nOriginally from New York City Alexis Lindsay began her professional career with Canadian Pacific Railway in 2005 as a Customer Service Operations Representative at their Minneapolis Minnesota headquarters. At Canadian Pacific Alexis honed her relationship-building and training skills successfully training and mentoring over 15+ new hires during her tenure in the role. In 2012 Alexis earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration from Metropolitan State University. After earning her degree Alexis joined CSX Transportation as a Service Center Manager before being promoted to Manager of Operations and Data Control. While in the role Alexis excelled at data analysis and operations support  resolving over 1000 support cases monthly.\n In 2017 Alexis earned her teaching certification and taught English as a foreign language in Prague Czech Republic. After returning to the United States Alexis gained experience in various industries from public transportation to commercial fire protection. Most recently as an Affiliate Service Coordinator at Commercial Fire Alexis leveraged her relationship-building and operational support talents to manage a rolling portfolio of fire systems work orders totaling over $500k. A proponent of continuous learning Alexis is on track to complete a Master of Project Management degree and a Master of Arts in Organizational Leadership in 2023. Today after completing the SV Academy Customer Success fellowship Alexis is keen to launch her career in the tech industry as a Customer Success professional.\n", "extra": null}, {"type": "file", "name": "PM PLA PERSONAL NARRATIVE.docx", "id": "file-PNEDFbPnloWCSGGqmVaULBzB", "source": "my_files", "text": "\nIn my professional journey I have developed a wide range of project management skills cultivated through various roles that demanded strategic planning decision-making and operational management. One of the most significant learning experiences in this regard was my involvement in the Trecce Capstone Project which was part of my Project Management Certification at Rome Business School. This project although rooted in reality was a planning exercise where I worked on creating a comprehensive project management plan. My role in the project included designing the Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) risk management plans and stakeholder engagement strategies. Although the project was not executed this experience reinforced my understanding of project management methods and tools including Agile and risk management practices which align with the first objective of the Project Management course: developing a comprehensive knowledge of project management methods styles and abilities.\nWhile Trecce was a valuable academic exercise my hands-on experience at CSX Transportation provided me with real-world application of these skills. At CSX I was responsible for overseeing and reporting remotely on rerailment operations during train derailments. This role required me to organize and dispatch mechanical staff and contractors order heavy lifting equipment and manage interdepartmental communications to ensure the timely resolution of derailments. This experience demonstrates my ability to manage complex high-stakes projects under pressure coordinating multiple teams and resources which directly aligns with the first course objective.\nIn addition to my role at CSX my previous positions further contributed to my expertise in modeling logical and administrative skills as required by the second course objective. During my time as Manager of Operations and Data Control at CSX I was responsible for overseeing over 1000 support cases each month. This role required me to structure complex tasks prioritize them based on urgency and allocate resources effectively to ensure timely outcomes. My LinkedIn endorsements for skills such as Operations Management and Project Planning serve as external validation of these abilities reflecting my capacity to manage operations efficiently while staying aligned with project goals.\nMy role as Service Delivery Manager at Jacksonville Transportation Authority (JTA) further demonstrated my ability to organize and analyze complex project management tasks. In this role I managed transit schedules ensuring on-time performance and addressing community engagement initiatives. These responsibilities required me to implement logical frameworks and administrative skills to evaluate and execute action plans that directly impacted the organization\u2019s goals. My presentation on service delivery at JTA highlighted my expertise in developing strategies that optimized both operational efficiency and customer satisfaction.\nAt CSX during the rerailment operations I also had to make critical decisions with wide-reaching impacts reflecting the third objective of the Project Management course which focuses on decision-making methods and their broader implications. Managing derailments involved coordinating between mechanical operational and administrative teams making strategic decisions that affected safety operational continuity and financial outcomes. These decisions had far-reaching consequences from managing human resources in real-time to coordinating heavy machinery and logistics which honed my ability to assess risk and make informed decisions under pressure.\nAdditionally in my role as Premier Affiliate Service Coordinator at Commercial Fire I managed a portfolio of fire systems work orders valued at over $500000. This position required careful attention to the relationships between procedures goods and financial outcomes. The role involved coordinating with multiple stakeholders including vendors and customers to ensure that projects were completed on time and within budget. My decisions during this time had a direct impact on revenue generation and operational success further reinforcing my ability to meet the third learning objective.\nThe final objective of the Project Management course evaluating project management technological tools is another area where I have developed significant expertise. At Acadly during my tenure as a Customer Success Manager I utilized CRM tools to enhance customer engagement and optimize project outcomes. By leveraging these tools I was able to improve data accuracy by 30% and increase user satisfaction by 20% within six months. The use of CRM systems allowed me to streamline processes and manage customer interactions more effectively demonstrating my ability to evaluate and implement technological tools for project success.\n", "extra": null}, {"type": "file", "name": "PM PLA PERSONAL NARRATIVE.docx", "id": "file-PNEDFbPnloWCSGGqmVaULBzB", "source": "my_files", "text": "\nMy role as Service Delivery Manager at Jacksonville Transportation Authority (JTA) further demonstrated my ability to organize and analyze complex project management tasks. In this role I managed transit schedules ensuring on-time performance and addressing community engagement initiatives. These responsibilities required me to implement logical frameworks and administrative skills to evaluate and execute action plans that directly impacted the organization\u2019s goals. My presentation on service delivery at JTA highlighted my expertise in developing strategies that optimized both operational efficiency and customer satisfaction.\nAt CSX during the rerailment operations I also had to make critical decisions with wide-reaching impacts reflecting the third objective of the Project Management course which focuses on decision-making methods and their broader implications. Managing derailments involved coordinating between mechanical operational and administrative teams making strategic decisions that affected safety operational continuity and financial outcomes. These decisions had far-reaching consequences from managing human resources in real-time to coordinating heavy machinery and logistics which honed my ability to assess risk and make informed decisions under pressure.\nAdditionally in my role as Premier Affiliate Service Coordinator at Commercial Fire I managed a portfolio of fire systems work orders valued at over $500000. This position required careful attention to the relationships between procedures goods and financial outcomes. The role involved coordinating with multiple stakeholders including vendors and customers to ensure that projects were completed on time and within budget. My decisions during this time had a direct impact on revenue generation and operational success further reinforcing my ability to meet the third learning objective.\nThe final objective of the Project Management course evaluating project management technological tools is another area where I have developed significant expertise. At Acadly during my tenure as a Customer Success Manager I utilized CRM tools to enhance customer engagement and optimize project outcomes. By leveraging these tools I was able to improve data accuracy by 30% and increase user satisfaction by 20% within six months. The use of CRM systems allowed me to streamline processes and manage customer interactions more effectively demonstrating my ability to evaluate and implement technological tools for project success. My endorsements on LinkedIn for skills such as Project Planning and Operations Management further attest to my ability to integrate technology into project management processes.\nIn addition my academic training at Rome Business School emphasized the importance of using technological tools in project management. During the course I gained hands-on experience with various project management software including tools designed for risk management and Agile methodologies. These experiences have equipped me with the knowledge to select the appropriate tools for different project environments ensuring that projects are managed efficiently and effectively.\nIn conclusion my professional experiences supported by endorsements certifications and project work align closely with the learning objectives of the Project Management course. Through roles that required strategic planning decision-making and the use of technological tools I have developed a robust skill set that reflects my comprehensive understanding of project management. Whether it was managing derailment operations at CSX overseeing complex transportation schedules at JTA or optimizing processes at Acadly each experience has contributed to my ability to meet the \nAUTHORITY\n\nJacksonville\nTransportation\nAuthority\n\nAlexis Lindsay  \n\nService Delivery Manager\n\nThe first 90 days\u2026\n\n\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nGoal Setting Criteria\n\n2\n\n\u2022 Realistic\n\u2022 Achievable\n\u2022 Dynamic\n\u2022 Hyper-efficient\n\u2022 Productive\n\n  \n\n\n\n3\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nExcellence In Execution\n\nCORE VALUES\n\u2022 Safe Work Environment\n\u2022 Professional Excellence\n\u2022 Personal Integrity\n\u2022 Fiscal Responsibility\n\u2022 Accountability \n\u2022 Transparency \n\u2022 Continuous Improvement\n\n\n\n4\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 30 Days\n\n\u2022 Complete all training\n\ufffd Safety Training \n\ufffd Operating Rules and Regulations\n\ufffd Organizational/Departmental Orientation\n\n\u2022 Ride roundtrip on all routes in service area\n\u2022 Get to know your team\n\u2022 Study and pass all Florida Commercial \n\nDriver\u2019s License Class \u201cB\u201d with  Passenger \nendorsement written exams\n\n\n\n\u2022 Implement guidelines and operating \nprocedures to ensure superior service to \ncustomers including safety and on-time \nperformance of transit operations.\n\n\u2022 Maintain performance and attendance \ninformation for each team member.\n\ufffd Review the attendance and performance evaluations of all \n\ndirect/indirect reports.\n\ufffd Job shadow all direct reports at least once.\n\ufffd Review and ensure all direct reports are in compliance with \n\nmandatory training.\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 60 Days\n\n\n\n\u2022 Process passenger complaints and take \ncorrective action.\n\n\u2022 Coordinate with JTA Command Center \npersonnel and operations supervisors to \nresolve questions about service delays or \nroute detours and changes.\n\n\u2022 Address all JTA bus stop and shelter issues \nand refer to appropriate staff for a resolution.\n\n\u2022 Obtain a Florida CDL Class \u201cB\u201d learners permit \nand begin practicing for the road test.\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 60 Days (cont\u2019d)\n\n\n\n\u2022 Identify and report JTA bus operator rule \nviolations and provide corrective coaching, \ncounseling, and disciplinary actions.\n\n\u2022 Respond to accidents, passenger disturbances \nand other events and resolve passenger and \nJTA Bus Operator problems.\n\n\u2022 Act as a community liaison throughout \nservice area and act as the liaison between \nOperations Supervisors and other JTA team \nmembers.\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 90 Days\n\n\n\n\u2022 Assist with special event organization and \nexecution (e.g., stadium shuttles, special \nservice requests, promotional outreach, new \nservice adjustments, public hearings etc.).\n\n\u2022 Coordinate required special projects and \nassigning tasks while overseeing transit \nsupervisors as needed.\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 90 Days (cont\u2019d)\n\n\n\n\u2022 Conduct regular team meetings and provides \nfeedback regarding performance.\n\n\u2022 Complete a minimum of 12 CDL Class B road \ntest practice hours.\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 90 Days (cont\u2019d)\n\n\n\nQUESTIONS &amp; COMMENTS\n", "extra": null}, exams\n\n\n\n\u2022 Implement guidelines and operating \nprocedures to ensure superior service to \ncustomers including safety and on-time \nperformance of transit operations.\n\n\u2022 Maintain performance and attendance \ninformation for each team member.\n\ufffd Review the attendance and performance evaluations of all \n\ndirect/indirect reports.\n\ufffd Job shadow all direct reports at and act as the liaison between \nOperations Supervisors and other JTA team \nmembers.\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 90 Days\n\n\n\n\u2022 Assist with special event organization and tasks while overseeing transit \nsupervisors as needed.\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 90 Days (cont\u2019d)\n\n\n\n\u2022 Conduct regular team meetings and provides \nfeedback regarding performance.\n\n\u2022 Complete a minimum of 12 CDL Class B road \ntest practice hours.\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 90 Days (cont\u2019d)\n\n\n\nQUESTIONS &amp; COMMENTS\n", "extra": null}, Issue log\n\nRISK MANAGEMENT\n\nRISK\n\n(1) Lack/absence of \n\nvolunteer chefs\n\n(2) Food donation failure \n\nor loss\n\nIMPACT\n\nHigh\n\nMedium\n\nMITIGATION \nSTRATEGY\n\nEngage key stakeholders in \n\nidentifying and providing \n\ninterested chefs, maintain \n\neffective communication, and \n\nalternate chef schedule \n\neffectively.\n\nFollow up on donations and \n\nmaintain regular contact with \n\nsponsor supermarkets\n\n\n\nCOMMUNICATION MANAGEMENT\n\nInternal communication External communication \n\nRASCI matrix\n\nCommunication plan\n# \u30101\u2020Personal Narrative Draft 2.docx\u2020file-qyOxHLGF5wIXlKlAeElEHg37\u3011\nPersonal Narrative \n\nAlexis Lindsay began her professional career as a Customer Service Operations Representative with Canadian Pacific Railway. In this role Alexis honed her relationship-building and training skills and successfully trained and mentored over 15+ new hires. In addition she earned a Bachelor&#x27;s degree in Business Administration from Metropolitan State University. Later  Alexis joined CSX Transportation and was promoted to Manager of Operations and Data Control where she excelled at data analysis and operations support\u2014resolving over 1000 support cases monthly.\n\nNext Alexis earned her teaching certification and taught English as a foreign language in Prague Czech Republic. Subsequently Alexis gained experience in various industries from public transportation to software development. Most recently as an Affiliate Service Coordinator at Commercial Fire Alexis leveraged her relationship-building and operational support talents to manage a rolling portfolio of fire systems work orders totaling $500k. A proponent of continuous learning Alexis will complete a Master of Project Management and a Master of Arts in Organizational Leadership in 2023. Today after completing the SV Academy Customer Success fellowship she\u2019s keen to launch her career in the tech industry as a Customer Success professional.\n# \u30102\u2020Personal Narrative Draft 1 (Alexis Lindsay, CS27).docx\u2020file-dMbcHVzlvVPkOlztnPFwKwAG\u3011\nPersonal Narrative \nI\u2019m originally from New York City but life and various professional opportunities have allowed me to make my home in multiple places over the years. Each place I move to it is a joy for me to explore the local culture and get to know the people. Reflecting on it I\u2019m confident that growing up and switching between my parent&#x27;s homes in two different states gave me an appreciation for constantly changing environments and the adaptability to enjoy them.\n\tI moved to Minnesota to attend career training in 2004 and eventually in 2012 I earned my Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration from Metropolitan State University. The following year after graduating from university I joined CSX railway in a managerial role. During my time with CSX railway  I discovered my talents for relationship building adaptability and process improvement to be an essential element to successfully leading teams and reaching desired outcomes. \n\tAfter leaving CSX I moved to Prague Czech Republic and became certified in teaching English as a foreign language. After earning my teaching certification I began working with young learners aged 5-14.  It was here that I further developed my presentation and public speaking skills. I leveraged these talents to support my students and their parents in reaching their desired learning outcomes. Overall it was immensely gratifying to find that by helping others reach their learning objectives through sharing my native language and culture I also synergistically maximized my cultural immersion experience.\n\tAfter returning to the United States I developed my professional skill set more.  I  worked in various industries from software development to fire protection systems. However my natural curiosity and dedication to continuous learning were always at the forefront driving me toward discovering where my most extraordinary talents lie. \nDuring this time I learned that I thrive on helping and supporting others and that my best tools to help others were through active listening and engagement. I also discovered that I am passionate about data-driven analytical thinking regardless of industry or position. I believe this is always the best approach to finding innovative solutions. Finally enthusiasm for an activity increases effectiveness; therefore I approach every task enthusiastically for efficiency and success. Today I am excited and enthusiastic to leverage these skills and talents in a customer success role where I\u2019ll be able to proactively support customers in reaching their desired outcomes while utilizing my vast array of talents to achieve organizational objectives.\n\n\n\nOriginally from New York City Alexis Lindsay began her professional career with Canadian Pacific Railway in 2005 as a Customer Service Operations Representative at their Minneapolis Minnesota headquarters. At Canadian Pacific Alexis honed her relationship-building and training skills successfully training and mentoring over 15+ new hires during her tenure in the role. In 2012 Alexis earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration from Metropolitan State University. After earning her degree Alexis joined CSX Transportation as a Service Center Manager before being promoted to Manager of Operations and Data Control. While in the role Alexis excelled at data analysis and operations support  resolving over 1000 support cases monthly.\n In 2017 Alexis earned her teaching certification and taught English as a foreign language in Prague Czech Republic. After returning to the United States Alexis gained experience in various industries from public transportation to commercial fire protection. Most recently as an Affiliate Service Coordinator at Commercial Fire Alexis leveraged her relationship-building and operational support talents to manage a rolling portfolio of fire systems work orders totaling over $500k. A proponent of continuous learning Alexis is on track to complete a Master of Project Management degree and a Master of Arts in Organizational Leadership in 2023. Today after completing the SV Academy Customer Success fellowship Alexis is keen to launch her career in the tech industry as a Customer Success professional.\n# \u30103\u2020Personal Narrative Draft 2.docx\u2020file-I8xRHh7mV7eOq1a2kntHexHI\u3011\nPersonal Narrative \n\nAlexis Lindsay began her professional career as a Customer Service Operations Representative with Canadian Pacific Railway. Today after completing the SV Academy Customer Success fellowship she\u2019s keen to launch her career in the tech industry as a Customer Success professional.\n# \u30104\u2020Personal Narrative Draft 1 (Alexis Lindsay, CS27).docx\u2020file-H6QijX4b25rovu5gfFd2CoPi\u3011\nPersonal Narrative \nI\u2019m originally from New York City but life and various professional opportunities have allowed me to make my home in multiple places over the years. Each place I move to it is a joy for me to explore the local culture and get to know the people. Reflecting on it I\u2019m confident that growing up and switching between my parent&#x27;s homes in two different states gave me an appreciation for constantly changing environments and the adaptability to enjoy them.\n\tI moved to Minnesota to attend career training in 2004 and eventually in 2012 I earned my Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration from Metropolitan State University. The following year after graduating from university I joined CSX railway in a managerial role. During my time with CSX railway  I discovered my talents for relationship building adaptability and process improvement to be an essential element to successfully leading teams and reaching desired outcomes. \n\tAfter leaving CSX I moved to Prague Czech Republic and became certified in teaching English as a foreign language. After earning my teaching certification I began working with young learners aged 5-14.  It was here that I further developed my presentation and public speaking skills. I leveraged these talents to support my students and their parents in reaching their desired learning outcomes. Overall it was immensely gratifying to find that by helping others reach their learning objectives through sharing my native language and culture I also synergistically maximized my cultural immersion experience.\n\tAfter returning to the United States I developed my professional skill set more.  I  worked in various industries from software development to fire protection systems. However my natural curiosity and dedication to continuous learning were always at the forefront driving me toward discovering where my most extraordinary talents lie. \nDuring this time I learned that I thrive on helping and supporting others and that my best tools to help others were through active listening and engagement. I also discovered that I am passionate about data-driven analytical thinking regardless of industry or position. I believe this is always the best approach to finding innovative solutions. Finally enthusiasm for an activity increases effectiveness; therefore I approach every task enthusiastically for efficiency and success. Today I am excited and enthusiastic to leverage these skills and talents in a customer success role where I\u2019ll be able to proactively support customers in reaching their desired outcomes while utilizing my vast array of talents to achieve organizational objectives.\n\n\n\nOriginally from New York City Alexis Lindsay began her professional career with Canadian Pacific Railway in 2005 as a Customer Service Operations Representative at their Minneapolis Minnesota headquarters. At Canadian Pacific Alexis honed her relationship-building and training skills successfully training and mentoring over 15+ new hires during her tenure in the role. In 2012 Alexis earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration from Metropolitan State University. After earning her degree Alexis joined CSX Transportation as a Service Center Manager before being promoted to Manager of Operations and Data Control. While in the role Alexis excelled at data analysis and operations support  resolving over 1000 support cases monthly.\n In 2017 Alexis earned her teaching certification and taught English as a foreign language in Prague Czech Republic. After returning to the United States Alexis gained experience in various industries from public transportation to commercial fire protection. Most recently as an Affiliate Service Coordinator at Commercial Fire Alexis leveraged her relationship-building and operational support talents to manage a rolling portfolio of fire systems work orders totaling over $500k. A proponent of continuous learning Alexis is on track to complete a Master of Project Management degree and a Master of Arts in Organizational Leadership in 2023. Today after completing the SV Academy Customer Success fellowship Alexis is keen to launch her career in the tech industry as a Customer Success professional.\n# \u30105\u2020PM PLA PERSONAL NARRATIVE.docx\u2020file-PNEDFbPnloWCSGGqmVaULBzB\u3011\nIn my professional journey I have developed a wide range of project management skills cultivated through various roles that demanded strategic planning decision-making and operational management. One of the most significant learning experiences in this regard was my involvement in the Trecce Capstone Project which was part of my Project Management Certification at Rome Business School. This project although rooted in reality was a planning exercise where I worked on creating a comprehensive project management plan. My role in the project included designing the Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) risk management plans and stakeholder engagement strategies. Although the project was not executed this experience reinforced my understanding of project management methods and tools including Agile and risk management practices which align with the first objective of the Project Management course: developing a comprehensive knowledge of project management methods styles and abilities.\nWhile Trecce was a valuable academic exercise my hands-on experience at CSX Transportation provided me with real-world application of these skills. At CSX I was responsible for overseeing and reporting remotely on rerailment operations during train derailments. This role required me to organize and dispatch mechanical staff and contractors order heavy lifting equipment and manage interdepartmental communications to ensure the timely resolution of derailments. This experience demonstrates my ability to manage complex high-stakes projects under pressure coordinating multiple teams and resources which directly aligns with the first course objective.\nIn addition to my role at CSX my previous positions further contributed to my expertise in modeling logical and administrative skills as required by the second course objective. During my time as Manager of Operations and Data Control at CSX I was responsible for overseeing over 1000 support cases each month. This role required me to structure complex tasks prioritize them based on urgency and allocate resources effectively to ensure timely outcomes. My LinkedIn endorsements for skills such as Operations Management and Project Planning serve as external validation of these abilities reflecting my capacity to manage operations efficiently while staying aligned with project goals.\nMy role as Service Delivery Manager at Jacksonville Transportation Authority (JTA) further demonstrated my ability to organize and analyze complex project management tasks. In this role I managed transit schedules ensuring on-time performance and addressing community engagement initiatives. These responsibilities required me to implement logical frameworks and administrative skills to evaluate and execute action plans that directly impacted the organization\u2019s goals. My presentation on service delivery at JTA highlighted my expertise in developing strategies that optimized both operational efficiency and customer satisfaction.\nAt CSX during the rerailment operations I also had to make critical decisions with wide-reaching impacts reflecting the third objective of the Project Management course which focuses on decision-making methods and their broader implications. Managing derailments involved coordinating between mechanical operational and administrative teams making strategic decisions that affected safety operational continuity and financial outcomes. These decisions had far-reaching consequences from managing human resources in real-time to coordinating heavy machinery and logistics which honed my ability to assess risk and make informed decisions under pressure.\nAdditionally in my role as Premier Affiliate Service Coordinator at Commercial Fire I managed a portfolio of fire systems work orders valued at over $500000. This position required careful attention to the relationships between procedures goods and financial outcomes. The role involved coordinating with multiple stakeholders including vendors and customers to ensure that projects were completed on time and within budget. My decisions during this time had a direct impact on revenue generation and operational success further reinforcing my ability to meet the third learning objective.\nThe final objective of the Project Management course evaluating project management technological tools is another area where I have developed significant expertise. At Acadly during my tenure as a Customer Success Manager I utilized CRM tools to enhance customer engagement and optimize project outcomes. By leveraging these tools I was able to improve data accuracy by 30% and increase user satisfaction by 20% within six months. The use of CRM systems allowed me to streamline processes and manage customer interactions more effectively demonstrating my ability to evaluate and implement technological tools for project success.\n# \u30106\u2020PM PLA PERSONAL NARRATIVE.docx\u2020file-PNEDFbPnloWCSGGqmVaULBzB\u3011\nMy role as Service Delivery Manager at Jacksonville Transportation Authority (JTA) further demonstrated my ability to organize and analyze complex project management tasks. In this role I managed transit schedules ensuring on-time performance and addressing community engagement initiatives. These responsibilities required me to implement logical frameworks and administrative skills to evaluate and execute action plans that directly impacted the organization\u2019s goals. My presentation on service delivery at JTA highlighted my expertise in developing strategies that optimized both operational efficiency and customer satisfaction.\nAt CSX during the rerailment operations I also had to make critical decisions with wide-reaching impacts reflecting the third objective of the Project Management course which focuses on decision-making methods and their broader implications. Managing derailments involved coordinating between mechanical operational and administrative teams making strategic decisions that affected safety operational continuity and financial outcomes. These decisions had far-reaching consequences from managing human resources in real-time to coordinating heavy machinery and logistics which honed my ability to assess risk and make informed decisions under pressure.\nAdditionally in my role as Premier Affiliate Service Coordinator at Commercial Fire I managed a portfolio of fire systems work orders valued at over $500000. This position required careful attention to the relationships between procedures goods and financial outcomes. The role involved coordinating with multiple stakeholders including vendors and customers to ensure that projects were completed on time and within budget. My decisions during this time had a direct impact on revenue generation and operational success further reinforcing my ability to meet the third learning objective.\nThe final objective of the Project Management course evaluating project management technological tools is another area where I have developed significant expertise. At Acadly during my tenure as a Customer Success Manager I utilized CRM tools to enhance customer engagement and optimize project outcomes. By leveraging these tools I was able to improve data accuracy by 30% and increase user satisfaction by 20% within six months. The use of CRM systems allowed me to streamline processes and manage customer interactions more effectively demonstrating my ability to evaluate and implement technological tools for project success. My endorsements on LinkedIn for skills such as Project Planning and Operations Management further attest to my ability to integrate technology into project management processes.\nIn addition my academic training at Rome Business School emphasized the importance of using technological tools in project management. During the course I gained hands-on experience with various project management software including tools designed for risk management and Agile methodologies. These experiences have equipped me with the knowledge to select the appropriate tools for different project environments ensuring that projects are managed efficiently and effectively.\nIn conclusion my professional experiences supported by endorsements certifications and project work align closely with the learning objectives of the Project Management course. Through roles that required strategic planning decision-making and the use of technological tools I have developed a robust skill set that reflects my comprehensive understanding of project management. Whether it was managing derailment operations at CSX overseeing complex transportation schedules at JTA or optimizing processes at Acadly each experience has contributed to my ability to meet the course objectives and apply these skills in real-world settings.\n# \u30107\u2020PMPFINAL.pdf\u2020file-C65p0U7wlAtOirCabrhRqVbX\u3011\nDaniela Galdi Italian Chefs Academy Director Partner Under notes.pdf\u2020file-aW3JviMC3hXScnVeC1ERRyCC\u3011\nJTA Presentation notes.pptx\n\n\nJACKSONVILLE TRANSPORTATION \nAUTHORITY\n\nJacksonville\nTransportation\nAuthority\n\nAlexis Lindsay  \n\nService Delivery Manager\n\nThe first 90 days\u2026\n\n\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nGoal Setting Criteria\n\n2\n\n\u2022 Realistic\n\u2022 Achievable\n\u2022 Dynamic\n\u2022 Hyper-efficient\n\u2022 Productive\n\n  \n\n\n\n3\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nExcellence In Execution\n\nCORE VALUES\n\u2022 Safe Work Environment\n\u2022 Professional Excellence\n\u2022 Personal Integrity\n\u2022 Fiscal Responsibility\n\u2022 Accountability \n\u2022 Transparency \n\u2022 Continuous Improvement\n\n\n\n4\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 30 Days\n\n\u2022 Complete all training\n\ufffd Safety Training \n\ufffd Operating Rules and Regulations\n\ufffd Organizational/Departmental Orientation\n\n\u2022 Ride roundtrip on all routes in service area\n\u2022 Get to know your team\n\u2022 Study and pass all Florida Commercial \n\nDriver\u2019s License Class \u201cB\u201d with  Passenger \nendorsement written exams\n\n\n\n\u2022 Implement guidelines and operating \nprocedures to ensure superior service to \ncustomers including safety and on-time \nperformance of transit operations.\n\n\u2022 Maintain performance and attendance \ninformation for each team member.\n\ufffd Review the attendance and performance evaluations of all \n\ndirect/indirect reports.\n\ufffd Job shadow all direct reports at least once.\n\ufffd Review and ensure all direct reports are in compliance with \n\nmandatory training.\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 60 Days\n\n\n\n\u2022 Process passenger complaints and take \ncorrective action.\n\n\u2022 Coordinate with JTA Command Center \npersonnel and operations supervisors to \nresolve questions about service delays or \nroute detours and changes.\n\n\u2022 Address all JTA bus stop and shelter issues \nand refer to appropriate staff for a resolution.\n\n\u2022 Obtain a Florida CDL Class \u201cB\u201d learners permit \nand begin practicing for the road test.\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 60 Days (cont\u2019d)\n\n\n\n\u2022 Identify and report JTA bus operator rule \nviolations and provide corrective coaching, \ncounseling, and disciplinary actions.\n\n\u2022 Respond to accidents, passenger disturbances \nand other events and resolve passenger and \nJTA Bus Operator problems.\n\n\u2022 Act as a community liaison throughout \nservice area and act as the liaison between \nOperations Supervisors and other JTA team \nmembers.\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 90 Days\n\n\n\n\u2022 Assist with special event organization and \nexecution (e.g., stadium shuttles, special \nservice requests, promotional outreach, new \nservice adjustments, public hearings etc.).\n\n\u2022 Coordinate required special projects and \nassigning tasks while overseeing transit \nsupervisors as needed.\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 90 Days (cont\u2019d)\n\n\n\n\u2022 Conduct regular team meetings and provides \nfeedback regarding performance.\n\n\u2022 Complete a minimum of 12 CDL Class B road \ntest practice hours.\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 90 Days (cont\u2019d)\n\n\n\nQUESTIONS &amp; COMMENTS\n# \u301010\u2020JTA Presentation notes.pdf\u2020file-a0t58fonLOUb5KkKmbErOzee\u3011\nJTA Presentation notes.pptx\n\n\nJACKSONVILLE TRANSPORTATION \nAUTHORITY\n\nJacksonville\nTransportation\nAuthority\n\nAlexis Lindsay  \n\nService Delivery Manager\n\nThe first 90 days\u2026\n\n\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nGoal Setting Criteria\n\n2\n\n\u2022 Realistic\n\u2022 Achievable\n\u2022 Dynamic\n\u2022 Hyper-efficient\n\u2022 Productive\n\n  \n\n\n\n3\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nExcellence In Execution\n\nCORE VALUES\n\u2022 Safe Work Environment\n\u2022 Professional Excellence\n\u2022 Personal Integrity\n\u2022 Fiscal Responsibility\n\u2022 Accountability \n\u2022 Transparency \n\u2022 Continuous Improvement\n\n\n\n4\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 30 Days\n\n\u2022 Complete all training\n\ufffd Safety Training \n\ufffd Operating Rules and Regulations\n\ufffd Organizational/Departmental Orientation\n\n\u2022 Ride roundtrip on all routes in service area\n\u2022 Get to know your team\n\u2022 Study and pass all Florida Commercial \n\nDriver\u2019s License Class \u201cB\u201d with  Passenger \nendorsement written exams\n\n\n\n\u2022 Implement guidelines and operating \nprocedures to ensure superior service to \ncustomers including safety and on-time \nperformance of transit operations.\n\n\u2022 Maintain performance and attendance \ninformation for each team member.\n\ufffd Review the attendance and performance evaluations of all \n\ndirect/indirect reports.\n\ufffd Job shadow all direct reports at least once.\n\ufffd Review and ensure all direct reports are in compliance with \n\nmandatory training.\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 60 Days\n\n\n\n\u2022 Process passenger complaints and take \ncorrective action.\n\n\u2022 Coordinate with JTA Command Center \npersonnel and operations supervisors to \nresolve questions about service delays or \nroute detours and changes.\n\n\u2022 Address all JTA bus stop and shelter issues \nand refer to appropriate staff for a resolution.\n\n\u2022 Obtain a Florida CDL Class \u201cB\u201d learners permit \nand begin practicing for the road test.\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 60 Days (cont\u2019d)\n\n\n\n\u2022 Identify and report JTA bus operator rule \nviolations and provide corrective coaching, \ncounseling, and disciplinary actions.\n\n\u2022 Respond to accidents, passenger disturbances \nand other events and resolve passenger and \nJTA Bus Operator problems.\n\n\u2022 Act as a community liaison throughout \nservice area and act as the liaison between \nOperations Supervisors and other JTA team \nmembers.\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 90 Days\n\n\n\n\u2022 Assist with special event organization and \nexecution (e.g., stadium shuttles, special \nservice requests, promotional outreach, new \nservice adjustments, public hearings etc.).\n\n\u2022 Coordinate required special projects and \nassigning tasks while overseeing transit \nsupervisors as needed.\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 90 Days (cont\u2019d)\n\n\n\n\u2022 Conduct regular team meetings and provides \nfeedback regarding performance.\n\n\u2022 Complete a minimum of 12 CDL Class B road \ntest practice hours.\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 90 Days (cont\u2019d)\n\n\n\nQUESTIONS &amp; COMMENTS\n# \u301011\u2020PMPFINAL.pdf\u2020file-C65p0U7wlAtOirCabrhRqVbX\u3011\nAngelica Carnelos Enel Cuore \u30100\u2020PM PLA PERSONAL NARRATIVE.docx\u2020file-PNEDFbPnloWCSGGqmVaULBzB\u3011\nIn my professional journey I have developed a wide range of project management skills cultivated through various roles that demanded strategic planning decision-making and operational management. One of the most significant learning experiences in this regard was my involvement in the Trecce Capstone Project which was part of my Project Management Certification at Rome Business School. This project although rooted in reality was a planning exercise where I worked on creating a comprehensive project management plan. My role in the project included designing the Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) risk management plans and stakeholder engagement strategies. Although the project was not executed this experience reinforced my understanding of project management methods and tools including Agile and risk management practices which align with the first objective of the Project Management course: developing a comprehensive knowledge of project management methods styles and abilities.\nWhile Trecce was a valuable academic exercise my hands-on experience at CSX Transportation provided me with real-world application of these skills. At CSX I was responsible for overseeing and reporting remotely on rerailment operations during train derailments. This role required me to organize and dispatch mechanical staff and contractors order heavy lifting equipment and manage interdepartmental communications to ensure the timely resolution of derailments. This experience demonstrates my ability to manage complex high-stakes projects under pressure coordinating multiple teams and resources which directly aligns with the first course objective.\nIn addition to my role at CSX my previous positions further contributed to my expertise in modeling logical and administrative skills as required by the second course objective. During my time as Manager of Operations and Data Control at CSX I was responsible for overseeing over 1000 support cases each month. This role required me to structure complex tasks prioritize them based on urgency and allocate resources effectively to ensure timely outcomes. My LinkedIn endorsements for skills such as Operations Management and Project Planning serve as external validation of these abilities reflecting my capacity to manage operations efficiently while staying aligned with project goals.\nMy role as Service Delivery Manager at Jacksonville Transportation Authority (JTA) further demonstrated my ability to organize and analyze complex project management tasks. In this role I managed transit schedules ensuring on-time performance and addressing community engagement initiatives. These responsibilities required me to implement logical frameworks and administrative skills to evaluate and execute action plans that directly impacted the organization\u2019s goals. My presentation on service delivery at JTA highlighted my expertise in developing strategies that optimized both operational efficiency and customer satisfaction.\nAt CSX during the rerailment operations I also had to make critical decisions with wide-reaching impacts reflecting the third objective of the Project Management course which focuses on decision-making methods and their broader implications. Managing derailments involved coordinating between mechanical operational and administrative teams making strategic decisions that affected safety operational continuity and financial outcomes. These decisions had far-reaching consequences from managing human resources in real-time to coordinating heavy machinery and logistics which honed my ability to assess risk and make informed decisions under pressure.\nAdditionally in my role as Premier Affiliate Service Coordinator at Commercial Fire I managed a portfolio of fire systems work orders valued at over $500000. This position required careful attention to the relationships between procedures goods and financial outcomes. The role involved coordinating with multiple stakeholders including vendors and customers to ensure that projects were completed on time and within budget. My decisions during this time had a direct impact on revenue generation and operational success further reinforcing my ability to meet the third learning objective.\nThe final objective of the Project Management course evaluating project management technological tools is another area where I have developed significant expertise. At Acadly during my tenure as a Customer Success Manager I utilized CRM tools to enhance customer engagement and optimize project outcomes. By leveraging these tools I was able to improve data accuracy by 30% and increase user satisfaction by 20% within six months. The use of CRM systems allowed me to streamline processes and manage customer interactions more effectively demonstrating my ability to evaluate and implement technological tools for project success.\n# \u30101\u2020PM PLA PERSONAL NARRATIVE (1).docx\u2020file-JufG1kHqiTXXSCgrxdrp7vYI\u3011\nIn my professional journey I have honed various project management skills through diverse roles that demanded strategic planning decision-making and operational management. One of the most significant learning experiences was my involvement in the Trecce Capstone Project part of my Project Management Certification at Rome Business School. This project although a planning exercise was rooted in reality. I was tasked with creating a comprehensive project management plan which included designing the Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) risk management plans and stakeholder engagement strategies. This experience although the project was not executed reinforced my understanding of project management methods and tools including Agile and risk management practices aligning with the first objective of the Project Management course: developing a comprehensive knowledge of project management methods styles and abilities.\nWhile the Trecce project was a valuable academic exercise my hands-on experience at CSX Transportation provided me with a real-world application of these skills long before completing any project management certification. At CSX I was responsible for overseeing and reporting remotely on rerailment operations during train derailments. This role required me to organize and dispatch mechanical staff and contractors order heavy lifting equipment and manage interdepartmental communications to ensure the timely resolution of derailments. This experience demonstrates my ability to manage complex high-stakes projects under pressure coordinating multiple teams and resources which directly aligns with the first course objective.\nMy role at CSX particularly as the Manager of Operations and Data Control further contributed to my expertise in modeling logical and administrative skills as required by the second course objective. Managing derailments involved coordinating between mechanical operational and administrative teams and making strategic decisions that affected safety operational continuity and financial outcomes. These decisions had far-reaching consequences from managing human resources in real-time to coordinating heavy machinery and logistics which honed my ability to assess risk and make informed decisions under pressure.\nAdditionally in my role as Premier Affiliate Service Coordinator at Commercial Fire I managed a portfolio of fire systems work orders valued at over $500000. This position required careful attention to the relationships between procedures goods and financial outcomes. The role involved coordinating with multiple stakeholders including vendors and customers to ensure that projects were completed on time and within budget. My decisions during this time had a direct impact on revenue generation and operational success further reinforcing my ability to meet the third learning objective.\nThe final objective of the Project Management course evaluating project management technological tools is another area where I have developed significant expertise. At Acadly during my tenure as a Customer Success Manager I utilized CRM tools to enhance customer engagement and optimize project outcomes. By leveraging these tools I was able to improve data accuracy by 30% and increase user satisfaction by 20% within six months. The use of CRM systems allowed me to streamline processes and manage customer interactions more effectively demonstrating my ability to evaluate and implement technological tools for project success. My decisions during this time had a direct impact on revenue generation and operational success further reinforcing my ability to meet the third learning objective.\nThe final objective of the Project Management course evaluating project management technological tools is another area where I have developed significant expertise. At Acadly during my tenure as a Customer Success Manager I utilized CRM tools to enhance customer engagement and optimize project outcomes. By leveraging these tools I was able to improve data accuracy by 30% and increase user satisfaction by 20% within six months. The use of CRM systems allowed me to streamline processes and manage customer interactions more effectively demonstrating my ability to evaluate and implement technological tools for project success. My endorsements on LinkedIn for skills such as Project Planning and Operations Management further attest to my ability to integrate technology into project management processes.\nIn addition my academic training at Rome Business School emphasized the importance of using technological tools in project management. During the course I gained hands-on experience with various project management software including tools designed for risk management and Agile methodologies. These experiences have equipped me with the knowledge to select the appropriate tools for different project environments ensuring that projects are managed efficiently and effectively.\nIn conclusion my professional experiences supported by endorsements certifications and project work align closely with the learning objectives of the Project Management course. Through roles that required strategic planning decision-making and the use of technological tools I have developed a robust skill set that reflects my comprehensive understanding of project management. Clear expectations regarding acceptable behaviour\n\nby project team members have been defined in the team charter to help promote understanding\n\nand decrease misunderstandings which could potentially lead to conflicts. All team members are\n\nrequired to abide by the stipulated guidelines as defined in the team charter.\n\nTeam Charter\n\nTeam members Roles\n\n(1) Alexis Lindsay Responsible for project quality and cost management, and conflict\n\nmanagement.\n\n(2) Mary Grace Hatcher Responsible for project scope and schedule management\n\n(3) Oliver Oliveros Responsible for project stakeholder engagement\n\n(4) Catelijne Ribbink Responsible for project communications management\n\n(5) Michael P. All project team\n\nmembers are expected to communicate openly, and in a clear,\n\nconcise, and progressive manner.\n\nMeeting guidelines Meetings shall be held respectively as detailed in the schedule\n\nmanagement plan. All team members and participants are expected\n\nto conduct themselves professionally. Idea sharing, positive\n\ndialogue, and motivation are highly emphasised. Active listening\n\nand respecting each other\u2019s opinion are required of all participants.\n\nMeeting minutes shall be recorded and shared always, and no\n\nmeeting shall exceed 45 minutes.\n\nDecision making\n\nprocess\n\nAll decisions shall be put to voting, and the unanimous majority\n\ncarries the vote. Members are strictly required to accept all agreed\n\nupon decisions, and work on executing all project tasks as assigned.\n\npage B44\n# \u301010\u2020PMPFINAL.pdf\u2020file-7kDm00qNx5CfMEv6nfvUg1bT\u3011\nlife cycle\n\nBiodegradable\n\ndual-purpose\n\nsalad/soup bowls\n\nand lids\n\nThese items will be procured and\n\nmade available to serve as food\n\ncontainers\n\nAvailable throughout the project\n\nlife cycle\n\nNapkins (200 pcs\n\nbox)\n\nThese items will be procured and\n\nmade available to be provided in\n\neach meal package\n\nAvailable throughout the project\n\nlife cycle\n\npage B42\n\n\n\nComputers This resource will be used for data\n\nentry, storage, and report writing\n\nAvailable throughout the project\n\nlife cycle\n\nBooks, papers, and\n\nfiles\n\nThese materials will be used in\n\nwriting, posting and display of\n\ninformation for all stakeholders\n\nAvailable throughout the project\n\nlife cycle\n\nServices\n\nProcurement Procurement services will be required for purchasing of all required\n\nproject materials and food items. All team members and participants are expected\n\nto conduct themselves professionally. Idea sharing, positive\n\ndialogue, and motivation are highly emphasised. Active listening\n\nand respecting each other\u2019s opinion are required of all participants.\n\nMeeting minutes shall be recorded and shared always, and no\n\nmeeting shall exceed 45 minutes.\n\nDecision making\n\nprocess\n\nAll decisions shall be put to voting, and the unanimous majority\n\ncarries the vote. Members are strictly required to accept all agreed\n\nupon decisions, and work on executing all project tasks as assigned.\n\npage B44\n# \u301015\u2020PMPFINAL.pdf\u2020file-C65p0U7wlAtOirCabrhRqVbX\u3011\nPage 10 of 10 page B36\n\n\n\nInventory and Quality Assessment Log\n\nDonor: Item Item Description Quantity\nQuality\nRating\n\nUse-by or\n Expiry date\n\npage B37\n\n\n\nPROJECT RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PLAN\n\nIn the Resource Management Plan, we define the approach to identify, acquire, and\n\nmanage the human and physical resources needed for the Trecce project. The physical resources\n\nconsist of  equipment, materials, facilities, and infrastructure. The human resource component is\n\ndivided into two parts, the internal and external resources. The internal resources are those\n\nacquired and assigned by the functional managers, in this project the Food Kitchen Coordinator\n\nserves in the capacity to assign internal resources. The external resources are those acquired\n\nthrough the procurement process and could also include external stakeholders leveraged for highly\n\nimportant project activities.\n\nHUMAN RESOURCE CHART\n\npage B38\n\n\n\nTOOLS\n\nThe Trecce Project Team will highly utilise negotiation skills, teamwork, collaboration, and\n\nmeetings as avenues to foster understanding of project goals, set defined rules, and build strong\n\nrelationships amongst all stakeholders. The Team will also exploit the opportunities created\n\nthrough the pre-project meetings to motivate all stakeholders especially Chefs and Student Chefs\n\n(sous-chef) in reminding them of the significance of this endeavour, which is designed to provide\n\ndecent meals to the poor/needy, undoubtedly a common desire we all share as stakeholders.\n\nTherefore, emotional intelligence is one of the key tools we will exploit during our meetings,\n\ninteractions, and communication with all human resources of the project.\n\nHUMAN RESOURCE IDENTIFICATION, ACQUISITION, AND MANAGEMENT\n\nThe Food Kitchen already has a coordinator (Carlo Virtu\u2019), and 3 other staff members. The\n\ncoordinator is responsible for directly managing his team, coordinating all project activities,\n\nreporting, and liaising with stakeholders. The Food Kitchen Coordinator is responsible for\n\nassigning tasks to his team, and the team of volunteers that report to work. His team of staff and\n\nvolunteers report directly to him.\n\nThe Trecce Project Team herein refers to the team of 5 project managers responsible for\n\nproject initiation, design, implementation, monitoring, reporting, liaison with all stakeholders, and\n\nproject closing. This Team is already available to work with the Food Kitchen Coordinator and staff\n\nto implement this project, and execute all tasks as defined in the project management plan to\n\nensure success.\n\nThere is great need for professional chefs to be sourced and invited to join the project. The\n\nTrecce project is highly dependent on these chefs to lead in assessing donated food items,\n\npreparing grocery lists, and preparing delicious and healthy meals for beneficiaries. They will be\n\nacquired through our MoU with the Italian Chefs Academy, Associazione Italiana Chef, and\n\nFederazione Italiana Cuochi. Some of the chefs might come from Chef Christina Bowerman\u2019s group\n\nof associates. They will be managed delicately and scheduled according to availability, to ensure\n\nthat there\u2019s always at-least one or two lead chefs available each day as planned in the project\n\nschedule.\n\nThe Trecce project will also source and attract Student Chefs to serve as sous-chefs. These\n\nindividuals will be responsible for assisting the lead chefs in assessing and preparing meals. They\n\nwill be managed and scheduled as available.\n\nThe project also highly depends on volunteers, local people from the community, churches,\n\nsocial groups, and schools to participate in the Food Kitchen during project events. These\n\nvolunteering contributions can be immense, ranging from cleaning, serving meals, arranging\n\nproject venue, etc.\n\nTEAM TRAINING, DEVELOPMENT AND BUILDING\n\nThe project is a one-month trial initiative; therefore, no capacity building event will be\n# \u301016\u2020PMPFINAL.pdf\u2020file-C65p0U7wlAtOirCabrhRqVbX\u3011\nengagement\n\n\u25cf Catelijne Ribbink, Responsible for project communications\n\nmanagement\n\n3. KEY STAKEHOLDERS\n\nEngagement and dialogue with stakeholders are crucial if a project\n\nis to become successful. Stakeholder engagement is the process of\n\ninteracting with actors involved in and impacted by a project. It is\n\nparticularly important to a project as its completion often depends\n\non how stakeholders see the project.\n\nVarious stakeholders are mobilized for this project, from the\n\nCoordinator and other staff working at the Mensa Giovanni Paolo\n\nII who are directly involved in the daily operations and\n\nmanagement of the establishment to the economically challenged\n\npersons who are the recipients of free meals provided by the\n\nMensa\u2019s feeding programme. In between are the different service\n\nproviders as well as range of volunteers involved in the project,\n\n1\n\npage D1\n\n\n\nMaster in Project Management\n\nTrecce Project Charter\n\ni.e., volunteer chefs and servers, current partners supporting the\n\nfeeding programme (i.e., Comune di Roma and the local church)\n\nand new partners providing funds and other resources mobilized\n\nfor the project and the project team.\n\nDetails on the engagement of stakeholders in the project (list,\n\nrationale for their involvement, the different \u201casks\u201d, and strategy\n\nfor their involvement/participation are outlined in the Project\n\nManagement Plan and related Annexes.\n\n4. PROJECT SCOPE\n\nPurpose of the\n\nproject\n\nTrecce Project aims to mobilize chefs and volunteers to participate\n\nin a month-long pilot event at Mensa Giovanni Paolo II in order to\n\nprepare and serve nutritious meals to the economically\n\ndisadvantaged while reducing food waste and fostering community\n\nengagement.\n\nProject objectives \u25cf Complete 13 days of dinner service\n\n\u25cf Reduce food waste and sustainably source all materials\n\n\u25cf Create a model for continued dinner service at the food\n\nkitchen\n\n\u25cf Foster community engagement\n\nHigh level\n\nrequirements\n\nRequirements needed to implement the project include (1) human\n\nresources (able project team, cooperation of the Mensa Giovanni\n\nPaolo II management and staff, volunteer chefs, student chefs,\n\nservers, partner foundations and establishments); (2) left-over\n\nfood supplies and ingredients coming from supermarkets; (3)\n\nfunding to purchase any ingredients and other materials/supplies\n\nneeded for the food service;  (4) functional/equipped and clean\n\nkitchen where food can be prepared and (5) space available where\n\nfood can be served.\n\nMain\n\ndeliverables\n\nFrom Project Management perspective\n\n\u25cf Project Management Plan\n\n\u25cf Project Budget\n\n\u25cf Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) and WBS dictionary\n\n\u25cf Activity List, Day of Service Schedule\n\n\u25cf Project Milestone\n\n\u25cf Procurement Management Plan\n\n\u25cf Project Resource Management Plan\n\n\u25cf Responsibility Assignment Matrix\n\n\u25cf Stakeholder Engagement Plan, Registry and Engagement\n\nMatrix\n\n\u25cf Communications Plan\n\n\u25cf Risk Register, Risk Management Plan\n\n\u25cf Requirements Traceability Matrix\n\nFrom project implementation itself\n\n\u25cf Financial resources mobilized:  36,000 EUR\n\n\u25cf Human Resources mobilized\n\n\u25cb Project Team\n\n\u25cb Mensa Giovanni Paolo II staff mobilized and onboard\n\n\u25cb Sufficient number of volunteers (Servers) recruited\n\n2\n\npage D2\n\n\n\nMaster in Project Management\n\nTrecce Project Charter\n\n\u25cb Sufficient number of qualified chefs engaged\n\n\u25cb Partner chef associations agreeing to send student chefs to\n\nthe project\n\n\u25cb Partners supermarket, establishment and food delivery\n\nservice providers mobilized\n\n\u25cf Nutritious meals cooked and served\n\n\u25cf Economically disadvantaged people benefitting from the\n\nTrecce Project\n\n5. PROJECT LIFE CYCLE\n\nProject\n\nmanagement\n\napproach\n\nPredictive\n\nProject Phases The project phases included are: planning, recruitment, a month\n\nof service, and follow up.\n\nPlanning will require creating schedules, procurement, organizing\n# \u301017\u2020PMPFINAL.pdf\u2020file-7kDm00qNx5CfMEv6nfvUg1bT\u3011\nPage 10 of 10 page B36\n\n\n\nInventory and Quality Assessment Log\n\nDonor: Item Item Description Quantity\nQuality\nRating\n\nUse-by or\n Expiry date\n\npage B37\n\n\n\nPROJECT RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PLAN\n\nIn the Resource Management Plan, we define the approach to identify, acquire, and\n\nmanage the human and physical resources needed for the Trecce project. These\n\nvolunteering contributions can be immense, ranging from cleaning, serving meals, arranging\n\nproject venue, etc.\n\nTEAM TRAINING, DEVELOPMENT AND BUILDING\n\nThe project is a one-month trial initiative; therefore, no capacity building event will be\n# \u301018\u2020Personal Narrative Draft 2.docx\u2020file-I8xRHh7mV7eOq1a2kntHexHI\u3011\nPersonal Narrative \n\nAlexis Lindsay began her professional career as a Customer Service Operations Representative with Canadian Pacific Railway. In this role Alexis honed her relationship-building and training skills and successfully trained and mentored over 15+ new hires. In addition she earned a Bachelor&#x27;s degree in Business Administration from Metropolitan State University. Later  Alexis joined CSX Transportation and was promoted to Manager of Operations and Data Control where she excelled at data analysis and operations support\u2014resolving over 1000 support cases monthly.\n\nNext Alexis earned her teaching certification and taught English as a foreign language in Prague Czech Republic. Subsequently Alexis gained experience in various industries from public transportation to software development. Most recently as an Affiliate Service Coordinator at Commercial Fire Alexis leveraged her relationship-building and operational support talents to manage a rolling portfolio of fire systems work orders totaling $500k. A proponent of continuous learning Alexis will complete a Master of Project Management and a Master of Arts in Organizational Leadership in 2023. Today after completing the SV Academy Customer Success fellowship she\u2019s keen to launch her career in the tech industry as a Customer Success professional.\n# \u301019\u2020JTA Presentation notes.pdf\u2020file-aW3JviMC3hXScnVeC1ERRyCC\u3011\nJTA Presentation notes.pptx\n\n\nJACKSONVILLE TRANSPORTATION \nAUTHORITY\n\nJacksonville\nTransportation\nAuthority\n\nAlexis Lindsay  \n\nService Delivery Manager\n\nThe first 90 days\u2026\n\n\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nGoal Setting Criteria\n\n2\n\n\u2022 Realistic\n\u2022 Achievable\n\u2022 Dynamic\n\u2022 Hyper-efficient\n\u2022 Productive\n\n  \n\n\n\n3\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nExcellence In Execution\n\nCORE VALUES\n\u2022 Safe Work Environment\n\u2022 Professional Excellence\n\u2022 Personal Integrity\n\u2022 Fiscal Responsibility\n\u2022 Accountability \n\u2022 Transparency \n\u2022 Continuous Improvement\n\n\n\n4\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 30 Days\n\n\u2022 Complete all training\n\ufffd Safety Training \n\ufffd Operating Rules and Regulations\n\ufffd Organizational/Departmental Orientation\n\n\u2022 Ride roundtrip on all routes in service area\n\u2022 Get to know your team\n\u2022 Study and pass all Florida Commercial \n\nDriver\u2019s License Class \u201cB\u201d with  Passenger \nendorsement written exams\n\n\n\n\u2022 Implement guidelines and operating \nprocedures to ensure superior service to \ncustomers including safety and on-time \nperformance of transit operations.\n\n\u2022 Maintain performance and attendance \ninformation for each team member.\n\ufffd Review the attendance and performance evaluations of all \n\ndirect/indirect reports.\n\ufffd Job shadow all direct reports at least once.\n\ufffd Review and ensure all direct reports are in compliance with \n\nmandatory training.\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 60 Days\n\n\n\n\u2022 Process passenger complaints and take \ncorrective action.\n\n\u2022 Coordinate with JTA Command Center \npersonnel and operations supervisors to \nresolve questions about service delays or \nroute detours and changes.\n\n\u2022 Address all JTA bus stop and shelter issues \nand refer to appropriate staff for a resolution.\n\n\u2022 Obtain a Florida CDL Class \u201cB\u201d learners permit \nand begin practicing for the road test.\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 60 Days (cont\u2019d)\n\n\n\n\u2022 Identify and report JTA bus operator rule \nviolations and provide corrective coaching, \ncounseling, and disciplinary actions.\n\n\u2022 Respond to accidents, passenger disturbances \nand other events and resolve passenger and \nJTA Bus Operator problems.\n\n\u2022 Act as a community liaison throughout \nservice area and act as the liaison between \nOperations Supervisors and other JTA team \nmembers.\n\nSERVICE DELIVERY MANAGER\nThe First 90 Days\n\n\n\n\u2022 Assist with special event organization and \nexecution (e.g., stadium shuttles, special \nservice requests, promotional
